document_data.mainbody:
Belvyn was a businessman in the settlement of Bargewright Inn in the Savage Frontier in the mid-to-late 14 century DR. He was the owner of Belvyns House of Good Cheer, a combined festhall, all-faiths temple, and rental hall.
Volo described him as "a sly, belly-rubbing rogue if ever I saw one", and he would know.
Belvyn charged 25 gp a night for hiring the hall, typically as either a festhall or a temple, while funerals were free of charge.
